1.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

2.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
Shalem, an early name of Jerusalem
a hut (as of entwined boughs); also a lair
{an abode, of God (the Tabernacle or the Temple), men (their home) or animals (their lair); hence, a retreat (asylum)}
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem

3.brief: there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
a live coal; by analogy lightning; figuratively, an arrow, (as flashing through the air); specifically, fever
a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris
a shield (i.e. the small one or buckler); figuratively, a protector; also the scaly hide of the crocodile
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
a battle (i.e. the engagement); generally, war (i.e. warfare)

4.brief: to be (causative, make) luminous (literally and metaphorically)
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
something torn, i.e. a fragment, e.g. a fresh leaf, prey, food

5.brief: to drop or strip; by implication, to plunder
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),

6.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to stun, i.e. stupefy (with sleep or death)
a vehicle; by implication, a team; by extension, cavalry; by analogy a rider, i.e. the upper millstone
a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight)

7.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
at that time or place; also as a conjunction, therefore
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire

8.brief: the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
judgement (the suit, justice, sentence or tribunal); by implication also strife
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten

9.brief: to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
depressed (figuratively), in mind (gentle) or circumstances (needy, especially saintly)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

10.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
a remainder or residual (surviving, final) portion
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)
to gird on (as a belt, armor, etc.)

11.brief: to promise (pos., to do or give something to God)
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
(as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around
properly, to flow; causatively, to bring (especially with pomp)
fear; by implication, a fearful thing or deed

12.brief: to gather grapes; also to be isolated (i.e. inaccessible by height or fortification)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
a commander (as occupying the front), civil, military or religious; generally (abstractly, plural), honorable themes
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

13.brief: to gather grapes; also to be isolated (i.e. inaccessible by height or fortification)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
a commander (as occupying the front), civil, military or religious; generally (abstractly, plural), honorable themes
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
